H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H1834.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of one of the {L:Aramaean<SDBH:אֲרָם>} kingdoms

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4654.def: = state in which a building or group of buildings has been fully or partially destroyed

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H6177.def: = town, better known as {L:Aroer<SDBH:עֲרֹועֵר>}; ◄ territory of {L:Reuben<SDBH:רְאוּבֵן>}

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H7257.def: = action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H1834.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of one of the {L:Aramaean<SDBH:אֲרָם>} kingdoms

H758.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a land and ethnic group with the same name

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H1809.def: = process by which the height of a body of water is diminished ◄ due to a drought

H4924.def: literally: fat; hence: = state in which land is of an exceedingly good quality

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H7054.def: = grain as it is growing on the field and awaiting harvesting; it burns easily; people can pluck the ears and eat the grains

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3950.def: = causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H7497.def: = man; ► ancestor of a tribe of giants

H5955.def: = crops that are left on the field after the harvest, ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the aftermath of an event

H2132.def: = tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈  regarded as beautiful and associated with well-being

glosses: beating (a tree to harvest its fruits)
H5363.def: = action by which humans insert a stick between the branches of an olive tree and thrash it back and forth, shaking the branches until most or all the olives drop off

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H1620.def: = the ripe fruit of an olive tree

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H534.def: = a secondary woody stem arising from the trunk or bough of a tree or the main stem of a shrub; also used as a collective

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H6509.def: = process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

12.gl: beating (a tree to harvest its fruits)

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H842.def: = female deity; ► worshiped by Canaanites, and symbolized with a wooden pole

H2553.def: = construction with a flat top; ◄ probably made out of stone; ► used for burning incense; ≈ associated with non-sanctioned worship

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H534.def: = a secondary woody stem arising from the trunk or bough of a tree or the main stem of a shrub; also used as a collective

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H5282.def: = state in which a plant has qualities that inspire appreciation

H5194.def: = vegetation, ◄ intentionally sown or planted by humans

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H2156.def: = part of a {L:vine<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>} which grows out of the trunk or a bough

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5194.def: = vegetation, ◄ intentionally sown or planted by humans

H7735.def: = causative action by which humans cause a plant to grow by giving it the care it needs

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H5067.def: = a large quantity of water, staying together as one heap as if it were a solid substance

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H3511.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H7582.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been destroyed

H3524.def: = state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H7582.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been destroyed

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H1605.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4671.def: = debris and husks crushed and separated from grain and carried away by the wind when threshing and winnowing ≈ associated especially with the transient nature and disappearance of evil people and enemies.

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1534.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
